intro: Moraea spithamaea, commonly known as the red moraea, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Iridaceae family and is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that range in color from red to pink. The plant typically grows in grasslands and rocky areas, preferring well-drained soils. It produces sword-shaped leaves and has a short, sturdy stem that supports its vibrant blooms. Moraea spithamaea is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and floral arrangements.
